member.summary: Provides a collection that can be modified safely on other threads. The notify event is thrown using the dispatcher from the event listener(s).

member.name: T:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1
member.summary: This class provides the base for concurrent collections that can be bound to user interface elements
member.notes: Could do with a more performant enumerable implementation but this is what I have so far. I create a snapshot of the collection and use the enumerable from that. When the collection is updated I set a flag indicating that a new snapshot is required.

member.name: P:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.IsDispatcherThread
member.summary: Gets if the calling thread is the same as the dispatcher thread

member.name: F:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.ReadWriteLock
member.summary: The lock that controls read/write access to the base collection

member.name: F:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.BaseCollection
member.summary: The underlying base enumerable that is used to store the items, used for creating an immutable collection from which an enumerator can be obtained.

member.name: F:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.NewSnapshotRequired
member.summary: Flag indicating that a write has occured, so anything that depends on taking a snapshot of the collection needs to be updated.

member.name: F:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.SnapshotLock
member.summary: The enumerable lock to prevent threading conflicts on allocating the enumerable of the fixed collection

member.name: F:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.BaseSnapshot
member.summary: The collection used for generating an enumerable that iterates over a snapshot of the base collection

member.name: F:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.Subscribers
member.summary: A list of observers

member.name: F:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.SubscriberKey
member.summary: The key for new observers, incremented with each new observer

member.summary: Flag indicating this collection is disposed

member.summary: Gets an immutable snapshot of the collection

member.summary: Gets the enumerator for a snapshot of the collection
member.remarks: Note that the Enumerator should really only be used on the Dispatcher thread, if not then should enumerate over the Snapshot instead.

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.System#Collections#IEnumerable#GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets the enumerator for a snapshot of the collection

member.summary: Updates the snapshot that is used to generate an Enumerator

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.DoBaseClear(System.Action)
member.summary: Removes all items from the .
member.remarks: Don't use BaseCollection.Clear(), it causes problems because it sends a reset event, and then the collection needs to be read out through an enumerator. Use RemoveAt instead until the collection is empty. Using remove from end after testing with this speed test:

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.HandleBaseCollectionChanged(System.Object,System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles when the base collection changes. Pipes the event through IObservable.OnNext
member.remarks: As this is a concurrent collection we don't want a change event to result in the listener later coming back to enumerate over the whole collection again, possible before the listener gets other changed events, but after the collection has been added to.

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.DoBaseRead(System.Action)
member.summary: Handles read access from the base collection

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.DoBaseRead``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Handles read access from the base collection when a return value is required

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.DoBaseReadWrite``1(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.Func{``0},System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Calls the read function passed in, and if it returns true, then calls the next read function, else calls the write function.

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.DoBaseReadWrite``1(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.Func{``0},System.Action,System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Calls the read function passed in, and if it returns true, then calls the next read function, else unlocks the collection, calls the pre-write function, then chains to DoBaseReadWrite calls the write function.

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.DoBaseWrite(System.Action)
member.summary: Handles write access to the base collection

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionBase`1.DoBaseWrite``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Handles write access to the base collection when a return value is required

member.summary: Token that comes back when subscribing to the .

member.summary: Token for removing the subscription action from the queue

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionViewModel`1.ProcessCommand(System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Processes a NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs event argument

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionViewModel`1.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposes of this object, and supresses the finalizer

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionViewModel`1.#ctor(System.IObservable{System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs})
member.summary: Constructor. Queues subscribing to the IObservable passed in.
member.remarks: We create a subscribe action, which has a reference to this object. If the DispatcherQueueProcessor isn't started (because the Dispatcher hasn't been created), then the subscriber action will sit in the queue forever, hence will never be garbage collection, hence this view model will never be garbage collected. To get around this the dispatcher subscription queue stores a weak reference. As such the Subscribe Action needs to be referenced in this class otherwise it will be garbage collected once we leave the scope of this constructor. the return token holds a reference to the Subscribe Action

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentCollectionViewModel`1.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizer, disposes of the object

member.summary: Executes a stream on actions on the dispatcher thread.

member.summary: This class is a singleton class. Below is the instance.

member.summary: A queue of actions to be called on the dispatcher thread

member.summary: A list of pending subscribers, processed once the Dispather is created. Using a ConcurrentDictionary because this is the only framework collection that has a remove method.

member.name: F:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.DispatcherQueueProcessor.Dispatcher
member.summary: The Application Dispatcher

member.name: F:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.DispatcherQueueProcessor.ActionWaiting
member.summary: The current action that is awaiting processing on the Dispatcher thread

member.summary: Semaphore used to prevent a race condition on ActionWaiting

member.name: P:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.DispatcherQueueProcessor.Instance
member.summary: Gets the instance of the singleton class

member.name: P:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.DispatcherQueueProcessor.IsDispatcherThread
member.summary: Tests if the calling thread is the same as the dispatcher thread

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.DispatcherQueueProcessor.#ctor
member.summary: Private constructor for this singleton class. Use the Instance property to get an instance of this class.

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.DispatcherQueueProcessor.CheckIfDispatcherCreated
member.summary: Checks if the dispatcher has been created yet

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.DispatcherQueueProcessor.StartQueueProcessing
member.summary: Starts the thread that processes the queue of actions that are to be executed on the dispatcher thread.

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.DispatcherQueueProcessor.Add(System.Action)
member.summary: Adds an action to the processing queue
member.remarks:
If we are running on the dispatcher thread, we could call the action directly, but then we've got the problem with queue jumping. It's desirable to immediately update the view model, as if we don't the code that added the item won't see it if an iteration is done over the collection, which would confuse the person using this collection.
So, we need to add it to the queue and then process the queue so the view is consistent with the Add action.

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.DispatcherQueueProcessor.QueueSubscribe(System.Action)
member.summary: Adds a subscribe action to the subscriber queue
member.remarks: Subscriber queue is set to null after the Dispatcher has been created. So subscriptions can be handled directly once the dispatcher queue is being processed.

member.name: T:Imagin.Common.Collections.Concurrent.DispatcherQueueProcessor.DisposeDelegate
member.summary: Result returned by "QueueSubscribe" method.

member.name: T:Imagin.Common.Input.RelayCommand
member.summary: A command whose sole purpose is to relay its functionality to other objects by invoking delegates. The default return value for the CanExecute method is 'true'. This class does not allow you to accept command parameters in the Execute and CanExecute callback methods.
member.remarks: If you are using this class in WPF4.5 or above, you need to use the GalaSoft.MvvmLight.CommandWpf namespace (instead of GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Command). This will enable (or restore) the CommandManager class which handles automatic enabling/disabling of controls based on the CanExecute delegate.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RelayCommand class that can always execute.
member.param: The execution logic.
member.exception: If the execute argument is null.

member.exception: If the execute argument is null.

member.remarks: If you are using this class in WPF4.5 or above, you need to use the GalaSoft.MvvmLight.CommandWpf namespace (instead of GalaSoft.MvvmLight.Command). This will enable (or restore) the CommandManager class which handles automatic enabling/disabling of controls based on the CanExecute delegate.

member.name: P:Imagin.Common.Input.WeakFunc`1.IsAlive
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the Func's owner is still alive, or if it was collected by the Garbage Collector already.

member.name: P:Imagin.Common.Input.WeakFunc`1.Target
member.summary: Gets the Func's owner. This object is stored as a .

member.name: P:Imagin.Common.Input.WeakFunc`1.FuncTarget
member.summary: Gets the owner of the Func that was passed as parameter. This is not necessarily the same as , for example if the method is anonymous.

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Input.WeakFunc`1.Execute
member.summary: Executes the action. This only happens if the Func's owner is still alive.
member.returns: The result of the Func stored as reference.

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Input.WeakFunc`1.MarkForDeletion
member.summary: Sets the reference that this instance stores to null.

member.name: T:Imagin.Common.Input.WeakFunc`2
member.summary: Stores an Func without causing a hard reference to be created to the Func's owner. The owner can be garbage collected at any time.
member.typeparam: The type of the Func's parameter.
The type of the Func's return value.

member.name: P:Imagin.Common.Input.WeakFunc`2.MethodName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the method that this WeakFunc represents.

member.name: P:Imagin.Common.Input.WeakFunc`2.IsAlive
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the Func's owner is still alive, or if it was collected by the garbage collector already.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the WeakFunc class.

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Input.WeakFunc`2.#ctor(System.Object,System.Func{`0,`1})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the WeakFunc class.
member.param: The Func's owner.
The Func that will be associated to this instance.

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Input.WeakFunc`2.Execute
member.summary: Executes the Func. This only happens if the Func's owner is still alive. The Func's parameter is set to default(T).
member.returns: The result of the Func stored as reference.

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Input.WeakFunc`2.Execute(`0)
member.summary: Executes the Func. This only happens if the Func's owner is still alive.
member.param: A parameter to be passed to the action.
member.returns: The result of the Func stored as reference.

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Input.WeakFunc`2.ExecuteWithObject(System.Object)
member.summary: Executes the Func with a parameter of type object. This parameter will be casted to T. This method implements and can be useful if you store multiple WeakFunc{T} instances but don't know in advance what type T represents.
member.param: The parameter that will be passed to the Func after being casted to T.
member.returns: The result of the execution as object, to be casted to T.

member.name: M:Imagin.Common.Input.WeakFunc`2.MarkForDeletion
member.summary: Sets all the funcs that this WeakFunc contains to null, which is a signal for containing objects that this WeakFunc should be deleted.

member.name: T:Imagin.Common.Drawing.Xyz
member.summary: Structure to define CIE XYZ color.
member.remarks:
There are 11 main illuminants: 1. A* 2. C* 3. D50* 4. D55* 5. D65* 6. D75 7. E*^ 8. F2 9. F7 10. F11 11. ICC*
* Defined in this struct ^ Theoretical
And 2 types of observers 1. 2 = 1931 2. 10 = 1964
This structure supports Observer = 2, Illuminant = D65 by default.
